title: Integrated STEM Inquiry-Based Project Design: Solving Practical Problems Through Mathematical Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics fundamentals (functions, geometry, statistics) and basic engineering design concepts
context.additional_context: A process where current secondary teachers design and implement STEM integrated projects under conditions similar to actual classroom environments, utilizing simple smartphone-based digital tools

learning_goals: Develop three project ideas integrating mathematics, science, and engineering principles to solve real-world workplace problems
Learners create STEM-integrated lesson design documents applying Inquiry-Based Learning methodologies

Learners can collect three types of real-life data (e.g., consumption patterns, health metrics) using smartphone-based tools (Google Sheets, measurement apps, etc.), perform descriptive statistics (mean, standard deviation) and visualization (bar graphs, scatter plots), apply a linear regression model, and submit a three-page report including predictive results.
Diagnose and improve the STEM integration level of project outputs on a 4-tier scale (initial/developing/matured/integrated) through peer assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
